name: Lock_PutEnvelopeLock
description:
Updates the lock information for a locked envelope.

You must include the `X-DocuSign-Edit` header
as described in
[EnvelopeLocks: create](/docs/esign-rest-api/reference/envelopes/envelopelocks/create/).


Use this method to change the duration
of the lock (`lockDurationInSeconds`)
or the `lockedByApp` string.

The request body is a full `lockRequest` object,
but you only need to specify the
properties that you are updating. For example:

```
{
  "lockDurationInSeconds": "3600",
  "lockedByApp": "My Application"
}
```

accountId.description: The external account number (int) or account ID GUID.

lockRequest.description: This request object contains information about the lock that you want to create or update.

lockDurationInSeconds.description: The number of seconds to lock the envelope for editing.  Must be greater than 0 seconds.

lockType.description: The type of lock.  Currently `edit` is the only supported type.

lockedByApp.description: A friendly name of the application used to lock the envelope.  Will be used in error messages to the user when lock conflicts occur.

templatePassword.description: The [password for the template](https://support.docusign.com/en/guides/ndse-user-guide-template-passwords). If you are using a lock for a template that has a password or an envelope that is based on a template that has a password, you must enter the `templatePassword` to save the changes.

useScratchPad.description: When **true,** a scratchpad is used to edit information.

lockRequest.x-ms-summary: This request object contains information about the lock that you want to create or update.

$block: Envelope locks let you lock an envelope to prevent any changes while you are updating an envelope.
